p: The effectiveness of the DEs and of the EO of O. basilicum, alone and in combination, were also evaluated in a medium-scale assay. An estimation of the number of alive adult beetles per kilogram of wheat is shown in Figure 2. RM-ANOVA showed that the grain infestation differed significantly among the treatment (F 3,8 = 10.531, p = 0.004). On average, the number of insects recorded in the wheat of the mini-silos during the period of observation (240 day) varied from 8.61 ± 0.78 to 1.53 ± 0.42 insects kg −1 for O. basilicum EO and DEs + EO, respectively ( Figure 3), with differences among treatments statistically significant (F 3,8 = 10.531, p = 0.004, mixed-model RM-ANOVA). DE combined with EO treatments lead to a three times lower grain infestation than the DEs only treatment ( Figure 3).
